com.cyc.kb.client

Class RuleImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyc.kb.client.KbObjectImpl<T>
      • com.cyc.kb.client.AssertionImpl
        • com.cyc.kb.client.RuleImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.cyc.kb.Assertion, com.cyc.kb.KbObject, com.cyc.kb.KbObject.KbObjectWithArity, com.cyc.kb.Rule

    public class RuleImpl
extends AssertionImpl
implements com.cyc.kb.Rule
    A Rule object is a facade for #$CycLRuleAssertion. A rule is a semantically well formed sentence, where the ANTECEDENT implies the CONSEQUENT. The sentence is non-atomic and may contain open variables.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    $Id: RuleImpl.java 176349 2017-12-19 01:38:11Z nwinant $
    Author:
    vijay

      • get

        @Deprecated
public static com.cyc.kb.Rule get(CycObject cycAssert)
                                       throws com.cyc.kb.exception.KbTypeException,
                                              com.cyc.kb.exception.CreateException
        Deprecated. 
        Get the Rule that corresponds to cycAssert. Throws exceptions if the object isn't in the KB, or if it is not actually a rule (i.e. it's not an instance of CycAssertion with the #$implies operator. )
        Parameters:
        cycAssert - assertion object
        Returns:
        an Rule object encapsulating on cycAssert
        Throws:
        com.cyc.kb.exception.KbTypeException - if cycAssert is not an instance of assertion with the #$implies operator
        com.cyc.kb.exception.CreateException

      • isValidCore

        protected boolean isValidCore(CycObject cycObject)
        This is not part of the supported, public KB API. Check that the candidate core object is a valid implication formula, a non-atomic sentence with possibly open sentences. In the CycKB the object would be valid #$CycLRuleAssertion Internally this method checks if the the cycObject is an instance of CycAssertion and the operator is #$implies.
        Overrides:
        isValidCore in class AssertionImpl
        Parameters:
        cycObject - the object that is checked for type given by getTypeString()
        Returns:
        See Also:
        for more comments

      • replaceTerms

        protected <O> O replaceTerms(Map substitutions)
                      throws com.cyc.kb.exception.KbTypeException,
                             com.cyc.kb.exception.CreateException
        Replace non-destructively a set of objects with another set of objects, in a Non-Atomic Term or a Sentence. Replacement is not supported within Assertions, Atomic Terms, Variables and Symbols. Although, set of objects replaced can be any KBObject or Java primitive object.
        Type Parameters:
        O -
        Parameters:
        substitutions - the replacement mapping
        Returns:
        A new object with the substitutions made in the original object
        Throws:
        com.cyc.kb.exception.KbTypeException
        com.cyc.kb.exception.CreateException
